title: Ivan Marin
text:
PhD Candidate specializing in competition economics at Universite de Bourgogne. Working at CESAER
My work combines causal inference, machine learning, and network analysis to study collusive behavior. I conduct econometric analysis to support antitrust enforcement and policy design.

title: Ivan Marin
text:
Many methods have been proposed for geographical market delineation, yet most are considered as data-intensive and technically demanding. This study operationalizes market delineation not only through price-based substitutability, but also by modeling the emergent geography of supplier relationships. We use an Exponential Random Graph model to test whether agglomeration effects, proximity mechanisms, and structural network features jointly determine where market boundaries are drawn in practice. We identify local markets based on bidding behavior in paving tenders from Quebec?s construction sector between 2012 and 2019.
